event_title: GDSC UNILORIN Hackathon
description: The Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC) UNILORIN Hackathon is an electrifying tech competition where students from the University of Ilorin and beyond come together to brainstorm, build, and present innovative software or hardware solutions within a limited timeframe. Typically spanning 24-48 hours, this high-energy event challenges participants to tackle real-world problems—such as healthcare, education, agriculture, or finance—using cutting-edge technologies like AI, blockchain, cloud computing, or mobile development.

Open to coders, designers, and entrepreneurs, the hackathon fosters collaboration, creativity, and technical skill development. Participants form teams, receive mentorship from industry experts, and pitch their prototypes to a panel of judges for prizes, networking opportunities, and potential incubation. Workshops and tech talks often accompany the event, offering insights into Google’s tools (e.g., Firebase, Flutter) and emerging trends.

Winners may secure funding, internships, or a chance to compete in national/international hackathons. The GDSC UNILORIN Hackathon isn’t just about winning—it’s a launchpad for student-led innovation, community building, and career growth in tech. Past editions have seen projects ranging from AI-powered chatbots for local farmers to waste management apps, reflecting UNILORIN’s commitment to sustainable development through technology.
